resource.source:
<objectXMLWrap>
               <did xmlns="urn:isbn:1-931666-22-9">
                  <unittitle>Records of the Office of the Chancellor (Henry MacCracken)</unittitle>
                  <unitid>RG 3.0.3</unitid>
                  <repository>
                     <corpname>New York University Archives</corpname>
                  </repository>
                  <langmaterial>
                     <language/>
                  </langmaterial>
                  <physdesc>
                     <extent>12.5 linear feet</extent>
                  </physdesc>
                  <unitdate>1884-1910</unitdate>
                  <abstract>The Records of the Henry M. MacCracken Administration have been divided into nine series containing materials that pertain to MacCracken's activities as vice chancellor and chancellor of New York University.</abstract>
               </did>
            </objectXMLWrap>
resource.title: Records of the Office of the Chancellor (Henry MacCracken) 1884-1910
resource.abstract: The Records of the Henry M. MacCracken Administration have been divided into nine series containing materials that pertain to MacCracken's activities as vice chancellor and chancellor of New York University.

resource.source:
<objectXMLWrap>
               <did xmlns="urn:isbn:1-931666-22-9">
                  <unittitle>Records of the Student Army Training Corps</unittitle>
                  <unitid>RG 43.1</unitid>
                  <repository>
                     <corpname>New York University Archives</corpname>
                  </repository>
                  <langmaterial>
                     <language/>
                  </langmaterial>
                  <physdesc>
                     <extent>2.0 linear feet</extent>
                     <extent>(5 boxes)</extent>
                  </physdesc>
                  <unitdate>1916-1921</unitdate>
                  <abstract>The records of the Student Army Training Corps Program (SATC) unit are part of the papers of Dean Marshall S. Brown, who served as chairman of NYU's SATC Committee from September 1918 to the following spring. The material includes both internal and external correspondence and memoranda, mainly between the members of NYU's SATC Committee and officials in various government departments.</abstract>
                  <origination>
                     <persname>Brown, Marshall Stewart, 1870-1948</persname>
                  </origination>
               </did>
            </objectXMLWrap>
resource.title: Records of the Student Army Training Corps 1916-1921
resource.abstract: The records of the Student Army Training Corps Program (SATC) unit are part of the papers of Dean Marshall S. Brown, who served as chairman of NYU's SATC Committee from September 1918 to the following spring. The material includes both internal and external correspondence and memoranda, mainly between the members of NYU's SATC Committee and officials in various government departments.
resource.displayEntry: Records of the Student Army Training Corps, 1916-1921

address.text: 70 Washington Square South  10th Fl.  New York, New York 10012  United States

resourceRelations.content: Records of the Student Army Training Corps, 1916-1921

resource.source:
<objectXMLWrap>
               <did xmlns="urn:isbn:1-931666-22-9">
                  <unittitle>Records of the Lyman R. Bradley Academic Freedom Case</unittitle>
                  <unitid>RG 19.2</unitid>
                  <repository>
                     <corpname>New York University Archives</corpname>
                  </repository>
                  <langmaterial>
                     <language/>
                  </langmaterial>
                  <physdesc>
                     <extent>4.0 Linear feet</extent>
                     <extent>4 linear feet (6 boxes)</extent>
                  </physdesc>
                  <unitdate>1947-1961</unitdate>
                  <physloc>11/D/3-4</physloc>
                  <abstract>The Records of the Lyman R. Bradley Academic Freedom Case detail the action of New York University in hearing charges and subsequent suspension of a tenured associate professor who was convicted of contempt of Congress in 1948. The collection consists of administrative records retained by three offices of the University: the Office of the Dean of Washington Square College; the Office of the Chancellor; and the Office of the Vice Chancellor, who as Secretary and Clerk of the University Council (later Board of Trustees) maintained the Council files.</abstract>
                  <origination>
                     <corpname>Office of the Secretary</corpname>
                  </origination>
               </did>
            </objectXMLWrap>
resource.title: Records of the Lyman R. Bradley Academic Freedom Case 1947-1961
resource.abstract: The Records of the Lyman R. Bradley Academic Freedom Case detail the action of New York University in hearing charges and subsequent suspension of a tenured associate professor who was convicted of contempt of Congress in 1948. The collection consists of administrative records retained by three offices of the University: the Office of the Dean of Washington Square College; the Office of the Chancellor; and the Office of the Vice Chancellor, who as Secretary and Clerk of the University Council (later Board of Trustees) maintained the Council files.
resource.displayEntry: Records of the Lyman R. Bradley Academic Freedom Case, 1947-1961

address.text: 70 Washington Square South  10th Fl.  New York, New York 10012  United States

resourceRelations.content: Records of the Lyman R. Bradley Academic Freedom Case, 1947-1961
